dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Big Tech earnings are coming, and Trump will be top of mind for investors
News Content: Big Tech’s earnings season kicks off next week with a flurry of announcements from some of the industry’s most important players including Apple (AAPL), Meta (META), and Microsoft (MSFT). With the new year well under way, and AI still the hottest ticket in Silicon Valley, you can expect plenty of conversations about how companies are monetizing the technology and how much they spend on capital expenditures related to constructing data centers and producing new AI models.

And looming over all of that will be how newly-inaugurated President Trump will impact tech’s biggest trend in years. Whether it’s tougher tariffs, export controls, or more relaxed antitrust regulations, Big Tech will be keeping a close eye on Washington. And investors are certain to want to know what that means for companies’ bottom lines.

Trump already made his mark on the AI scene on Tuesday, announcing Stargate, a $500 billion AI data center company headed by Softbank, OpenAI, and Oracle (ORCL) that will see the trio construct data centers to power AI projects within the U.S.

It’s all going to make for quite an interesting earnings season, and it kicks off with Meta and Microsoft on Wednesday.

The Trump factor

Investors and analysts will want to know how companies are working with the administration to ensure they don’t end up on the wrong end of Trump’s proposed tariffs on goods from China.

Apple (AAPL), whose CEO Tim Cook has a good relationship with the president, avoided tariffs during the first Trump administration and will look to do so this time around, as well. Amazon (AMZN), Apple, Google (GOOG, GOOGL), Meta, and Microsoft could also see less regulation around antitrust matters and a return to mergers and acquisitions.(L-R) Priscilla Chan, Meta founder Mark Zuckerberg, Lauren Sanchez, Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Tesla CEO Elon Musk attend the inauguration of Donald Trump on January 20, 2025. (Photo by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)·Chip Somodevilla via Getty Images

There’s also the fate of the CHIPS Act. The legislation, passed under the Biden administration is meant to bring semiconductor manufacturing back to the US. But Trump has criticized the law, which provides billions in funding to chip makers, saying it was “so bad” during an appearance on Joe Rogan’s podcast ahead of the election.

Without the cash, Intel (INTC), TSMC, Samsung, and a slew of other semiconductor companies may not be able to complete their ambitious plans to build new chip making facilities. Look for word on how the likes of Intel and its competitors are navigating the new administration and whether it’s heard how it plans to address the CHIPS Act.

AI revenue and spending

In addition to Trump, you can guarantee that virtually every tech company will mention AI revenue and spending. According to Jefferies analyst Brent Thill, Microsoft should report improved AI consumption and continued spending, something investors have been hoping for as the company works to meet customer demand for AI infrastructure.

Story Continues

During its prior quarter, Microsoft reported better than anticipated overall revenue and cloud and AI sales. But that wasn’t enough to satisfy investors, sending the company’s stock sinking 5% the day after the report.

Meta’s stock suffered a similar setback following its earnings last quarter, with shares falling after the company announced full-year 2024 cap-ex spending would increase from $37-$40 billion to $38-$40 billion.

•USD

(AMZN)

Follow  View Quote Details

Google and Amazon, on the other hand, won over investors with Google beating expectations on cloud revenue and Amazon improving overall margins.

Microsoft shares are up just 12% over the last 12 months, lagging the broader S&P 500, which rose 25% during the period. Amazon and Google shares are up 50% and 34%, respectively, while shares of Meta have climbed 64%.

TikTok’s clock gets a reset

One of the biggest issues for Meta and Google is what Trump will do with TikTok. Both companies stand to gain users and advertising dollars if the short-form video app is banned in the US. But Trump is working with TikTok CEO Shou Chew to find a way to keep the app up and running, despite a law calling for it to go offline.

If Trump and TikTok can’t find a solution, the app might bite the dust, leaving its 170 million users, and the advertisers that want to reach them, with no place to turn than competing apps like Instagram and YouTube, which would be a boon for both companies.

But with Trump proclaiming that he’d “save” TikTok on the campaign trail, it will be hard for him to back away from keeping the app afloat. We'll see what TikTok's rivals have to say, if anything, beginning next week.Sign up for Yahoo Finance's Week in Tech newsletter.·yahoofinance

Email Daniel Howley at dhowley@yahoofinance.com. Follow him on Twitter at @DanielHowley.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The headline suggests a positive outlook on the stock market, specifically mentioning a 'bull market' which typically indicates rising stock prices. This could lead to increased investor confidence in Apple Inc. (AAPL), potentially driving the stock price up. However, without specific details about Apple's performance or market conditions, the probabilities are estimated conservatively. The overall sentiment appears bullish, leading to a higher probability of price increase.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article presents a mixed bag of potential impacts on Apple (AAPL). On one hand, Tim Cook's good relationship with President Trump could help Apple avoid tariffs, which would be positive. Relaxed antitrust regulations could also benefit Apple, potentially opening doors for mergers and acquisitions. However, uncertainty surrounding the CHIPS Act and its potential impact on the semiconductor industry, a critical component of Apple's products, introduces a negative element. The article also highlights the importance of AI revenue and spending, and while Apple is expected to discuss these topics, the market's reaction is uncertain, as seen with Microsoft and Meta's recent earnings disappointments despite strong AI narratives. The potential impact of Trump's stance on TikTok is less directly relevant to Apple compared to Meta and Google. Considering these factors, the potential for positive outcomes (tariff avoidance, relaxed regulations) is balanced by the uncertainty surrounding the CHIPS Act and the market's reaction to AI-related announcements. Therefore, I estimate a slightly higher probability of a neutral to slightly positive impact on the stock price.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news presents conflicting perspectives on Apple's future.  Jefferies downgrades Apple due to weak iPhone sales expectations and concerns about the AI strategy rollout.  However, Wedbush maintains a positive outlook, highlighting manageable China unit declines, the potential for a significant AI partnership, and the long-term growth potential of Apple Intelligence.  The disagreement between these reputable firms suggests significant uncertainty. While the short-term outlook appears bearish due to immediate sales concerns, the long-term potential of AI integration and the Wedbush's bullish price target of $325 (significantly higher than the current price) suggest a higher probability of a rise in the long term.  The current market reaction is mixed, with a slight increase after the initial drop.  Therefore, I assign a higher probability to a price rise, reflecting the long-term bullish sentiment, but acknowledge the significant short-term risks.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news headline suggests that while Apple may lack innovation, this should not concern investors. This implies that Apple's current business model and financial performance are strong enough to sustain investor confidence despite criticisms about innovation. Historically, Apple has demonstrated resilience and strong market performance even during periods of perceived innovation lulls. Therefore, the impact of this news on the stock price is likely neutral to slightly positive, as it reassures investors that innovation is not the sole driver of Apple's success.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news discusses the impact of the new administration, particularly President Trump, on Big Tech companies including Apple Inc. (AAPL). Key points include potential tariffs on goods from China, antitrust regulations, and the CHIPS Act. Trump's relationship with tech CEOs, like Tim Cook of Apple, might influence company-specific outcomes. Additionally, AI revenue and spending will be a focus, with companies like Microsoft and Meta already seeing significant investments in AI. For Apple, avoiding tariffs and navigating the new administration's policies on AI and semiconductors could positively impact its stock price. However, uncertainty around Trump's policies and their implementation could lead to volatility.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article discusses the Indian government's request for Apple and Google to host the GOV.in app suite on their respective app stores. While this could potentially increase Apple's presence in the Indian market, the company's reluctance to cooperate and the possibility of legal actions or policy directives may create uncertainty and negatively impact the stock price. Additionally, the comparison to Apple's similar action in Russia in 2021 may suggest that the company is willing to comply with local regulations, but the current situation in India may be more complex. Overall, the news is likely to have a neutral to slightly negative impact on Apple's stock price.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.2, Reasoning: The news describes Perplexity launching a new AI assistant for Android as competition to existing services like Siri and Alexa. This might not directly impact Apple Inc.'s stock price since it is more about competitive dynamics within the AI assistant market. However, there's a slight positive sentiment as it indicates ongoing innovation and potential for partnerships or improvements in Apple's own AI offerings.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news article presents a mixed outlook for Apple. On the positive side, Tim Cook's relationship with President Trump could help Apple avoid tariffs, and relaxed antitrust regulations could benefit the company. The focus on AI revenue and spending is also relevant, although the market's reaction is uncertain. However, the uncertainty surrounding the CHIPS Act and its potential impact on the semiconductor industry, a critical component of Apple's products, introduces a negative element. The previous predictions are quite varied, with some leaning positive and others negative. Given the mixed signals and the uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies, I'm assigning a slightly higher probability to a rise, but acknowledging the significant risks.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Big Tech earnings are coming, and Trump will be top of mind for investors",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.55,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.45
}
```
